channel.title: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: First Look: The FDA's Nutrition Label Gets A Makeover
item.description: The FDA has released its mock-up of a proposed new label for food. On it, calorie counts go big and bold. What's out? Listing calories from fat. What else is new? More details on added sugars.
item.content:encoded:
The FDA has released its mock-up of a proposed new label for food. On it, calorie counts go big and bold. What's out? Listing calories from fat. What else is new? More details on added sugars.

» E-Mail This

item.title: The Web At 25: Hugely Popular And Viewed As A Positive Force
item.description: A quarter-century already? It seems just like yesterday. A new Pew survey looks back on how much the World Wide Web's popularity — and role in our lives — has grown since its birth in 1989.
item.content:encoded:
A quarter-century already? It seems just like yesterday. A new Pew survey looks back on how much the World Wide Web's popularity — and role in our lives — has grown since its birth in 1989.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Mapping Differences In America's Musical Tastes, State By State
item.description: If you're in the Pacific, there's a better chance you're nodding along with Cat Power rather than grooving to Fantasia — but that reverses if you're across the country in the South Atlantic.
item.content:encoded:
If you're in the Pacific, there's a better chance you're nodding along with Cat Power rather than grooving to Fantasia — but that reverses if you're across the country in the South Atlantic.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Arizona Gov. Brewer Vetoes Controversial Bill
item.description: The legislation would have allowed business owners to refuse service to gays and others if the customers offended their religious beliefs.
item.content:encoded:
The legislation would have allowed business owners to refuse service to gays and others if the customers offended their religious beliefs.

» E-Mail This

item.title: To Play The Part, Actors Must Talk The Talk — In Chinese
item.description: As Hollywood and China grow closer, more roles are opening up for Asian-American actors to play Chinese-speaking characters. But before they can sound fluent on screen, some turn to dialect coaches.
item.content:encoded:
As Hollywood and China grow closer, more roles are opening up for Asian-American actors to play Chinese-speaking characters. But before they can sound fluent on screen, some turn to dialect coaches.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Debbie Dingell Poised To Keep U.S. House Seat In The Family
item.description: Despite Rep. John Dingell's assertion that he and his wife "are coming home" when he retires at the end of the year, Debbie Dingell is expected to announce Friday her intention to run for his seat.
item.content:encoded:
Despite Rep. John Dingell's assertion that he and his wife "are coming home" when he retires at the end of the year, Debbie Dingell is expected to announce Friday her intention to run for his seat.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Robot Swarm: A Flock Of Drones That Fly Autonomously
item.description: Inspired by birds that fly in tight bunches, researchers fit drones with GPS, processors, and radios that allow them to navigate in formation or while following a leader.
item.content:encoded:
Inspired by birds that fly in tight bunches, researchers fit drones with GPS, processors, and radios that allow them to navigate in formation or while following a leader.

» E-Mail This

item.title: The Search For Drinking Water In California Has Led To The Ocean
item.description: As the state slogs through a major drought, officials look for new water sources — like desalination plants that make water from the Pacific drinkable. Opponents worry about environmental damage.
item.content:encoded:
As the state slogs through a major drought, officials look for new water sources — like desalination plants that make water from the Pacific drinkable. Opponents worry about environmental damage.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Ask Me Anything: Reporting From Ground Zero In Ukraine
item.description: NPR's Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson answers Redditors' questions about covering the demonstrations in Kiev's Independence Square, the ouster of President Viktor Yanukovych and the road ahead for Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson answers Redditors' questions about covering the demonstrations in Kiev's Independence Square, the ouster of President Viktor Yanukovych and the road ahead for Ukraine.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Maybe That BPA In Your Canned Food Isn't So Bad After All
item.description: There's been lots of debate about whether tiny amounts of the chemical have the potential to cause health problems. A new FDA study supports a previous conclusion that the chemical is safe for people.
item.content:encoded:
There's been lots of debate about whether tiny amounts of the chemical have the potential to cause health problems. A new FDA study supports a previous conclusion that the chemical is safe for people.

» E-Mail This

item.title: More Hints That Dad's Age At Conception Helps Shape A Child's Brain
item.description: A study that took many other potential influences into account found that kids born to men 45 and older were more likely than the children of younger fathers to develop autism or ADHD.
item.content:encoded:
A study that took many other potential influences into account found that kids born to men 45 and older were more likely than the children of younger fathers to develop autism or ADHD.

» E-Mail This

item.title: With Tech Outsourcing, The Internet Can Be 'A Scary Place'
item.description: When you hear the word outsourcing, you might think of threats to jobs. To cyber experts, there's another threat: to our data. Hiring third parties with lax security can leave data vulnerable.
item.content:encoded:
When you hear the word outsourcing, you might think of threats to jobs. To cyber experts, there's another threat: to our data. Hiring third parties with lax security can leave data vulnerable.

» E-Mail This

item.title: You Got What In The Mail? Home Test Boosts Colon Cancer Screening
item.description: Not enough people get screened for colon cancer, and minority or low-income people are even less likely. But simply sending people a test and following up by phone or mail got results.
item.content:encoded:
Not enough people get screened for colon cancer, and minority or low-income people are even less likely. But simply sending people a test and following up by phone or mail got results.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Scientists Question Safety Of Genetically Altering Human Eggs
item.description: Researchers say they can replace DNA in human eggs with genetic material from another woman to prevent devastating disorders in children. But big questions remain on safety and ethics.
item.content:encoded:
Researchers say they can replace DNA in human eggs with genetic material from another woman to prevent devastating disorders in children. But big questions remain on safety and ethics.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Teachers Unions Mobilize To Delay The Common Core
item.description: The president of the largest U.S. teachers union is calling on school districts to delay adopting the Common Core education standards. The union's the latest group to voice concerns over Common Core.
item.content:encoded:
The president of the largest U.S. teachers union is calling on school districts to delay adopting the Common Core education standards. The union's the latest group to voice concerns over Common Core.

» E-Mail This
